clinical_study.brief_title: Hippocampal Stimulation in Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Enhancing Cortical-hippocampal Functional Connectivity as a Novel Means for Relieving Chronic Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: In this study the investigators aim to examine the effects of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) on hippocampal network connectivity and pain levels in individuals with chronic low back pain.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will receive the 2 modalities of stimulation (hippocampal and sham-TMS). Each stimulation round is composed by 5 daily sessions of stimulation, participants will not know which round is active and which is sham. The order of the stimulation modalities will be different across subjects. Subjects will be randomly assigned to one of two possible modality order according to the entrance in the study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: approximately 6 weeks - Baseline and after the end of hippocampal stimulation
primary_outcome.description: Changes in hippocampal network connectivity will be evaluated by using resting state functional magnetic resonance (fMRI) before and after hippocampal stimulation. Hippocampal connectivity measurements - regions involved in the network and the parietal target - will be compared before stimulation (baseline) to after stimulation (after active hippocampal stimulation).

secondary_outcome.description: The end point will be severity of pain measured by changes in chronic back pain as indexed by a Numeric rating Scale (NRS) before and after each stimulation round.

arm_group.description: Active high-frequency rTMS (20 Hz pulse trains)

intervention.description: For the brain stimulation the investigators will use Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic stimulation (rTMS). Different stimulation conditions (hippocampal or sham) will be delivered in each round of stimulation (5 days). Repetitive TMS will be applied at 100% resting motor threshold intensity, 20 Hz pulse trains separated by 28-s inter-train intervals (~20 minutes for the entire daily stimulation session). Stimulation parameters will be identical in both groups
